title: Teaching Experience 2
text:
StepUpTutoring — Tutor, Virtual
[Jan. 2025 – Oct. 2025]
Program Website

Delivered one-on-one virtual tutoring in English Language Arts and Math to elementary students, meeting twice weekly through an online learning platform
Created individualized lesson plans and practice materials tailored to each student’s academic level and learning needs
Increased student engagement using interactive tools, real-time feedback, and consistent positive reinforcement
Communicated effectively with non-English-speaking parents by using translated messages and audio tools to ensure shared understanding of goals and progress
Supported families facing technology challenges by securing free laptop loans and troubleshooting connectivity issues to maintain steady participation
Modified instruction using multiple teaching modalities—including numerical examples, real-world applications, and visual aids—to support diverse learning styles and enhance comprehension

title: Teaching Experience 1
text:
Cal Teach — Math Teaching Assistant, Los Angeles, CA Dec. 2024 – Jun. 2025 Program Website

Supported instruction in high school Statistics and Calculus classrooms by assisting with lesson delivery and offering individualized student support
Guided students through challenging mathematical concepts using one-on-one tutoring and small-group learning sessions
Created and graded practice assignments aligned with Common Core standards to strengthen understanding and improve test readiness
Worked with mentor teachers to review student performance data and adjust lesson plans and teaching strategies accordingly

title: Aly Tan
text: Hi! My name is Aly Tan. I’m a 4th-year undergraduate student at UCLA, majoring in Statistics and Data Science. My academic interests include statistical modeling, data visualization, and exploring how data influences decisions in everyday life. I’m also working toward becoming a math teacher, and I hope to use my background in data to help students understand mathematical ideas in a clear, engaging, and relevant way.

title: Aly Tan
text:
Education
University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) | Los Angeles, CA Bachelor of Science | Sept 2024 - June 2026

title: Teaching Experience 3
text:
A Plus Education — Tutor, Los Angeles, CA Jan. 2020 – Feb. 2020

Supported Chinese immigrant families in an after-school program by providing academic guidance and language assistance
Used bilingual communication to explain school expectations in Mandarin and discuss student progress with parents
Helped families understand and navigate the U.S. school system, strengthening home–school connections
Built an inclusive learning environment by ensuring multilingual parents felt informed and involved in their children’s education
